DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study explore effect Oxford unicompartmental knee arthroplasty two group patient , namely one genu recurvatum procedure one without . Specifically , study compare number occurrence postoperative genu recurvatum postoperative hyperextension angle among patient . Additionally , knee score , pain score , functional score two group patient compare . Materials method : This study prospectively follow 104 patient ( 114 knee ) treat cement minimally invasive surgery unicompartmental knee arthroplasty minimum 24 month follow-up . The patient divide two group : without preoperative genu recurvatum ( 85 patient ; 94 knee ) preoperative genu recurvatum ( 19 patient ; 20 knee ) . The incidence postoperative genu recurvatum , postoperative hyperextension angle , knee score , pain score , functional score record compare two groups..
DOC.brief_title: The Results Oxford Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty Patients With Without Preoperative Genu Recurvatum
DOC.detailed_description: The patient group apply cement Oxford unicompartmental knee arthroplasty surgeon . The patient perform surgery minimally invasive surgery technique . The gender , site , range motion , alignment prosthesis , operative time , blood loss , posterior slope tibial component also record compare two group . The incidence postoperative genu recurvatum , gender , site compute use Fisher 's exact test . The hyperextension angle , knee score , pain score , functional score , range motion , alignment prosthesis , posterior slope tibial component , operative time , blood loss compare student t-test .
DOC.criteria: The medial OA knee old 40 year age , ROM great 90° , varus deformity le 25° , flexion contracture less 20° patient diagnose spontaneous osteonecrosis knee ( SPONK ) , patient intraoperative ACL insufficiency , post traumatic arthritis , gouty arthritis , inflammatory joint .
